metadata.Description: A measure of the average cost of generating electricity from a particular source over its lifetime, taking into account the initial investment, operating costs, and expected output.

level 1.Description: The levelized cost of electricity is implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to ensure cost-effective energy generation and consumption.
The levelized cost of electricity provides funding for various renewable energy projects to promote sustainable energy generation.
The levelized cost of electricity focuses on implementing cost reduction strategies to make energy generation more affordable and accessible.
The levelized cost of electricity is used in energy market analysis to assess the competitiveness of different energy sources.
The levelized cost of electricity partners with the Electricity Regulatory Authority to ensure fair pricing and regulation in the energy sector.
The levelized cost of electricity contributes to the overall energy transition by promoting the adoption of renewable energy sources.
The levelized cost of electricity monitors energy consumption patterns to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
The levelized cost of electricity targets affordable energy access for all, especially in underserved communities.
